pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:0.2: The nuns’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing suspension
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:0.4: 5. The training rule on receiving food
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:1.2: At that time the nun Sundarīnandā was beautiful.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:1.3: When people saw her in the dining hall, they gave her the best food, both the donors and the recipient having lust.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:1.4: The nun Sundarīnandā ate as much as she wanted,
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:1.5: but other nuns did not get as much as they had intended.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:1.6: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:1.7: “How could Venerable Sundarīnandā, being lustful, eat either staple or non-staple food after personally receiving it from the hands of a lustful man?” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:1.8: “Is it true, monks, that the nun Sundarīnandā did this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:1.11: “… How can Sundarīnandā, being lustful, eat either staple or non-staple food after personally receiving it from the hands of a lustful man?
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:1.12: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:1.13: And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule thus:
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:1.14: ‘If a lustful nun eats staple or non-staple food after personally receiving it from the hands of a lustful man, then that nun too has committed an immediate offense entailing sending away and suspension.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:2.1.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:2.1.6: having lust, longing for, in love with.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:2.1.8: having lust, longing for, in love with.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:2.1.10: a human male, not a male spirit, not a male ghost, not a male animal. He understands and is capable of having lust.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:2.1.12: apart from the five staple foods and water and toothwood—the rest is called “non-staple food”.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:2.1.14: there are five kinds of staple food: cooked grain, porridge, flour, fish, and meat.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:2.1.15: If she receives staple or non-staple food with the intention of eating it, she commits an serious offense.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:2.1.16: For every mouthful, she commits an offense entailing suspension.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:2.1.18: this is said with reference to the preceding offenses.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:2.1.20: there is an offense as soon as the misconduct is committed, and no pressing is required.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:2.1.22: she is sent away from the Sangha.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:2.1.24: … Therefore, too, it is called an offense entailing suspension.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:2.2.1: If she receives water or toothwood, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:2.2.2: If only the man has lust, and she receives staple or non-staple food with the intention of eating it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:2.2.3: For every mouthful, she commits a serious offense.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:2.2.4: If she receives water or toothwood, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:2.2.5: If both of them have lust, and she receives staple or non-staple food with the intention of eating it from the hand of the male spirit, the male ghost, the eunuch, or the male animal in human form, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:2.2.6: For every mouthful, she commits a serious offense.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:2.2.7: If she receives water or toothwood, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:2.2.8: If only the male being has lust, and she receives staple or non-staple food with the intention of eating it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:2.2.9: For every mouthful, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:2.2.10: If she receives water or toothwood, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:2.3.3: if she receives knowing that the man has no lust;
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:2.3.5: if she is the first offender.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:2.3.6: The fifth offense entailing suspension is finished.
